meanings.definition: To feel disgust or strong dislike.
meanings.sent1: The smell of rotten eggs really scunners me.
meanings.sent2: I scunners the taste of brussels sprouts.
meanings.sent3: The slimy texture of the food scunners me, but I can't stop laughing at it.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the overflowing garbage can scunners me like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The thought of eating bugs for dinner scunners me to the core.

meanings.definition: A feeling of disgust or strong dislike.
meanings.sent1: Whenever I see spiders, I get a scunners in my stomach.
meanings.sent2: The scunners on his face was evident when he saw the mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: Her scunners for horror movies is so strong that she watches them with her eyes closed.
meanings.sent4: The scunners in the room was palpable as the mystery smell lingered.
meanings.sent5: The scunners in the air was so thick you could almost taste it.

meanings.definition: To cause disgust or strong dislike.
meanings.sent1: The spoiled milk scunners the entire room.
meanings.sent2: His rude behavior scunners everyone around him.
meanings.sent3: The prank was meant to scunners her, but she ended up laughing instead.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the creepy crawlies scunners the kids at the campfire.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine scunners him more than the illness itself.
